top.name: Attached Anchor
entries: A capstan swabbie is attached to its anchor by a 100-foot-long rope, most of which it keeps coiled around its body. If the capstan swabbie tries to move more than 100 feet from its attached anchor, its Speed is reduced to 10 feet as it drags the anchor along with it. If this rope is severed (AC 12 when uncoiled, Hardness 4, HP 16), the capstan swabbie can move freely, but its ranged anchor {@action Strike} loses the {@trait tethered} trait.

top.name: Mate's Expertise
entries: The capstan swabbie can use {@skill Athletics} to {@action Aid} an ally's {@skill Lore||Sailing Lore} check (to hoist or lower sails or the anchor, for instance). On a success or critical success, the capstan swabbie grants its ally a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering check.

bot.name: Jury-Rig
entries: The capstan swabbie uses built-in tools to quickly patch itself up. The swabbie gains 10 temporary Hit Points. The swabbie can also use this section on an adjacent section of a ship. The temporary Hit Points last for 1 minute. The target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

bot.name: Loose the Pawls
entries: The capstan swabbie spins around rapidly, its loose ropes whipping everyone in reach. The capstan swabbie makes a rope {@action Strike} against each creature within 10 feet and compares its attack roll to the AC of each creature within 10 feet.

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

mid.name: Animal Kindness
entries: Vulnerability Kithangians find kindness to animals revolting. The first time each round that a kithangian sees someone heal or otherwise provide aid to a creature that has the {@trait animal} trait, the kithangian takes {@damage 3d6} mental damage.

bot.name: Animal Killer
entries: A kithangian's melee Strikes deal an additional {@dice 2d6} damage to animals.

bot.name: Change Shape
entries: The kithangian can take on the appearance of any Medium or Large animal. This doesn't change its Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

bot.name: Rasping Tongues
bot.requirements: The kithangian has a creature {@condition grabbed} in one or both pincers
entries: Barbed tongues slither out of the faces in the kithangian's pincers. The tongues burrow into {@condition grabbed} creatures and inject their minds with haunting psychic screams. Each {@condition grabbed} creature takes {@damage 2d8} piercing damage and {@damage 2d8} mental damage. A creature can try to resist the mental damage by attempting a DC 25 basic Will save.

top.name: Camouflage
entries: The glimmervine can {@action Hide} in natural environments even if it doesn't have cover.

bot.name: Constrict
entries: {@damage 2d6+4} bludgeoning, DC 21

bot.name: Dazzling Blooms
entries: The glimmervine shakes its iridescent blossoms to astound nearby foes. All creatures within 30 feet, except other glimmervines, must attempt a DC 21 Fortitude save. The glimmervine then can't use Dazzling Blooms for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

Failure: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.
Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition blinded} for 1 round, then {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.

mid.name: Swallow Projectile
mid.trigger: A creature the kvernknurr can see targets it with a ranged {@action Strike}
mid.requirements: The kvernknurr doesn't have a creature {@condition grabbed} in its jaws
entries: The kvernknurr attempts to swallow the projectile, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the kvernknurr consumes the projectile harmlessly.

bot.name: Swallow Whole
entries: Medium, {@damage 1d6+5} bludgeoning, Rupture 15

bot.name: Frightening Bellow
bot.requirements: The kvernknurr doesn't have a creature {@condition grabbed} in its jaws
entries: The kvernknurr lets out a deep-throated shout to scare away its foes. Each non-kvernknurr creature within 60 feet must attempt a DC 20 Will save, and then they are temporarily immune to that kvenknurr's Frightening Bellow for 24 hours.

Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened||frightened 2} and is {@condition fleeing} as long as it remains {@condition frightened}.

resistances.name: physical
resistances.note: while within 500 feet of a ley line

top.name: Ley Line Sense
entries: The myroga can sense the presence, direction, and strength of any ley line within 1 mile.

bot.name: Draconic Frenzy
entries: The myroga makes two talon {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.

bot.name: Ley Line Empowerment
bot.requirements: The myroga is within 500 feet of a ley line
entries: The myroga wreathes itself in raw destructive energy converted from the ley line's ambient magic. The myroga deals an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage with each of its next successful fangs, tail, and talon {@action Strike}. Once its dealt damage with one of these {@action Strike||Strikes}, the energy is discharged from that body part, but not the others.

bot.name: Ley Line Rupture
bot.requirements: The myroga is within 500 feet of a ley line
entries: The myroga diverts some of the ley line's magic into a deadly and distant explosion. The myroga creates a detonation of force in a 5-foot square within a mile of its ley line and that it can see, dealing {@damage 5d6} force damage to creatures (DC 24 basic Reflex save). A myroga can will the detonation into existence anywhere within a mile of the ley line, possibly allowing it to ignore cover the target might have from, for example, an obstacle between itself and the myroga.

top.name: Surgical Mandibles
entries: A skin beetle can use its mandibles as healer's tools.

bot.name: Anesthetic Saliva
entries: A creature exposed to a skin beetle's saliva must succeed on a DC 19 Fortitude save or become {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1} for 1 round.

bot.name: Harvest Flesh
entries: The skin beetle makes a mandibles {@action Strike} against an animal or humanoid. If the {@action Strike} deals damage, the beetle tears off a large portion of flesh, dealing an additional {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.

bot.name: Swarming Bites
entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 5d6} piercing damage (DC 23 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails the saving throw also takes {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and is {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1} as long as it's taking bleed damage.

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs non-magical

mid.name: Aura of Good Cheer
entries: 30 feet. The green monkey's affable demeanor is contagious. Allies within the aura gain a +1 status bonus to Will saves against {@trait emotion} effects.

mid.name: Nimble Dodge
mid.trigger: The green monkey is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see
entries: The green monkey gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

bot.name: Bond with Mortal
entries: The spirit guide forms a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide's current and maximum Hit Points increase by 10, the spirit guide gains a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls, and the spirit guide and bonded mortal can communicate telepathically as long as they're on the same plane. The spirit guide can be bonded with only one mortal at a time, and can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Material Plane. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the {@trait incorporeal} and {@trait spirit} traits, loses their immunities and resistances, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.

bot.name: Bonded Strike
bot.requirements: The spirit guide is currently Bonded with a Mortal
entries: The spirit guide makes a jaws {@action Strike}. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to {@action Strike} the same target.

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs non-magical

mid.name: Warning Hoot
mid.trigger: The stone-breasted owl is about to roll a {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} check to determine initiative
entries: The stone-breasted owl lets out a hoot to warn allies, granting each ally a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative roll.

bot.name: Bond with Mortal
entries: As nimble green monkey, except HP increases by 14.

bot.name: Bonded Strike
bot.requirements: The spirit guide is currently Bonded with a Mortal
entries: The spirit guide makes a talon {@action Strike}. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to {@action Strike} the same target.

bot.name: Empowered Healing
entries: When the stone-breasted owl casts heal, it rolls {@dice d10|d10s} instead of {@dice d8|d8s}.

top.name: Search the Stars
top.requirements: Sakuachi is holding an astrolabe and can see the stars
entries: Sakuachi spends 1 hour attempting to gain a vague glimpse of the future written in the stars. She attempts a DC 24 {@skill Lore||Fortune-Telling Lore} or {@skill Occultism} check.

Critical Success: Sakuachi receives an accurate vision of an event to come within the next week. While this vision can be vague and confusing, it's typically true.
Success: As critical success, but the vision is of an event that will occur within the next day. If nothing noteworthy is to happen within the next day, she sees nothing written in the stars.
Failure: Sakuachi sees nothing written in the stars.
Critical Failure: Sakuachi misinterprets the writing in the stars and receives an inaccurate vision of an upcoming event. Such a vision looks the same as one achieved with a critical success, but is typically false.

props.name: all damage
props.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs non-magical

items.name: Alkoasha's Head Regrowth
entries: Alkoasha uses the same rules for a typical {@creature hydra||hydra's} head regrowth, except it starts the battle with 10 heads and each uncauterized stump regrows only one head, rather than two.

creature.name: Valmar
items: keys to the front door (area {@b E2}) and dungeon cell (area {@b E12})

bot.name: Shield Ally
entries: The Committee loyalist's shield is sturdier in their hands. The statistics for the shield above include this benefit; it's a normal steel shield for anyone else.

bot.name: Retributive Strike
entries: The Committee loyalist can {@action Step} to put a foe in reach before making a melee {@action Retributive Strike}.

bot.name: Shield Block
entries: Speed 20 feet

creature.name: Ghodrak the Quick
creature.description: Male hobgoblin leader of the Obsidian Oath

top.name: Into the Fray
entries: Ghodrak {@action Interact||Interacts} to draw one of his hatchets. On his turn, before doing anything else, he can {@action Stride} toward an enemy he can see as a free action.

bot.name: Axe Critical Specialization When
entries: Ghodrak lands a critical hit with a hatchet {@action Strike}, he can choose one creature adjacent to the initial target (and within reach if the critical hit was a melee {@action Strike}). If the creature's AC is lower than Ghodrak's attack roll result for the critical hit, he deals damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die rolled. This amount isn't doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

mid.name: Construct Armor
entries: Like normal objects, an apothecary's cabinet has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an apothecary's cabinet is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.

bot.name: Poison Stock
entries: When the cabinet hits a creature with its poison bottle {@action Strike}, roll {@dice 1d4} to determine what kind of poison splashes onto the struck creature: {@b 1} nerve poison ({@condition clumsy||clumsy 1}); {@b 2} weakening poison ({@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 1}); {@b 3} noxious poison ({@condition sickened||sickened 1}); {@b 4} clouded mind poison ({@condition stupefied||stupefied 1}). The target must attempt a DC 24 Fortitude save.

Failure: The creature takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage and is afflicted with the rolled poison's associated condition until the end of its next turn.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage and is afflicted with the rolled poison's associated condition for {@dice 1d4+1} rounds.
